website_summaries.verdict: The best option for a router that's easy to install and use.
pros: With 4 dedicated antennas, connectivity through interior walls and other objects is reliable
Makes it easy to get a good connection virtually anywhere in the home
cons: More expensive compared to other ASUS models

customer_reviews.title: CONSTANT 2.4Ghz DROPS!!!
customer_reviews.text: After owning for a few months I cannot recommend this router. Notice that 2.4ghz clients would have frequent internet drop-outs. 5Ghz working perfectly. I always update to latest firmware and still 2.4ghz drops. I reboot router in the morning, when I come home from work, 2.4ghz dead... but 5ghz fine. Do a google search and find many with similar issues. Very dissapointed,,, expensive router... will try to get replacement/refund.
customer_reviews.author: A. Suarez

customer_reviews.title: NO IMPROVEMENT AT ALL FROM PREVIOUS ROUTER PROVIDED FOR FREE  FROM MY INTERNET SERVICE PROVIDER
customer_reviews.text: No improvement AT ALL in speeds from my FREE junk router from my internet provider. What a farce. I am SO disappointed. I was so excited to get a significant improvement, particularly, in my TVs streaming, and this router did nothing. And Asus support, who I had multiple calls with, was virtually useless. I'm no expert with this stuff but it seems to me the router is correctly hooked up but it's just doing nothing. I don't have "dead zones" per se but I have "extremely weak zones" and "medium zones" and this brand new very expensive Asus 3100 router gave them No improvement at all. The signals everywhere in the house are as weak as ever.
customer_reviews.author: Hammond

customer_reviews.title: but part from the excellent working, I discovered some nice possibilities that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I knew this router should be too advanced for me, but part from the excellent working, I discovered some nice possibilities that I like. F.i. a very good overview of the connected devices in my house and a disk that can be connected (via ftp) from everywhere. Very satisfied! Update: The router stopped working after only nine months of working. Very disappointing experience for an expensive router. So after all a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Aloysius B. Heijst

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully you don't get a lemon
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive the RT-AC88U due to all its great reviews. For the 1st month or 2, it worked great. Then the wireless issues started. the 2.4 and 5Ghz radios would turn off randomly. I thought the firmware upgrades would help. They do for a short time. After the latest firmware upgrade, it is even worse. 2.4 Ghz works fine but the 5Ghz radio appears to be dead and non functional. The indicator light does not even turn on. I tried rebooting, downgrading firmware to previous version, powercycling router, enabling/disabling radio in router settings....but no luck. Tried contacting support but the email function does not work. There is never anyone available for technical support chat.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J.

customer_reviews.title: I don't write many reviews, but when an expensive router's 2.4 GHz dies...
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I spent this much money on a router. The router was working fine and great from May 2020 until now...July 2020. The 2.4 GHz is completely dead with no internet connection. Sure, the 5 GHz works good, but I have a few things that only connect to 2.4 GHz only. I guess I learned my lesson: Don't spend over $200 on a router and read the reviews, and more reviews...and more reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Dean

customer_reviews.title: Not stable under heavy use
customer_reviews.text: Fast router that has an intermittent issue with the 5GHz band dropping out to either some clients or everything for a minute when their is heavy wifi load (several video conferences and downloading files). The router seems to automatically restart the 5GHz wifi band and then everything works ok again. This only brought down the entire router, requiring a restart once. Not the same quality or stability of my older Asus router that is now just a mesh node,but this has some seriously good performance.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Died after only 23 months - $269.99 down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Router provided great coverage and significantly increased speeds compared to my ancient apple router. However, last night it stopped working. I have reinstalled everything. I have checked that my internet modem is working fine. Spoke with my provider and connected the model directly via ethernet to my computer. I can configure the wireless router fine via the Wi-Fi connection, that portions works. But it cannot connect to the internet. I have factory reset the router 3 times. But it refuses to connect to the internet. After paying $269.99 it is quite disappointing that it stops working after only 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Per

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Description is very misleading. Ordered router for 3100 sqft house but signal was so poor. I pay for 1GB internet and I was getting 2MB in my bedroom. Called customer service and after 1 hour of changing multiple configurations, they said I needed to return and order a replacement as this was ‘defective’. Got a replacement and same problem. Ridiculous for the amount of money it costs, DO NOT RECOMMEND. Got the Orbi and I had lightening fast internet in less than 10 min, I even had WiFi at my mailbox..
customer_reviews.author: Charu

customer_reviews.title: 2.4GHz didn't work after one day.
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up and everything worked great! For ONE day. After the first day I noticed my ecobee thermostat didn't have a WiFi connection. Tried connecting and nothing. When I went to the router GUI to see what was going on, the 2.4GHZ band wasn't broadcasting. I had all the right settings, but it just wasn't working. After much researching, firmware changes, and tinkering, nothing worked. It was only then I see on message boards that this is a common issue with the hardware. I even got Amazon Tech support to try and help to no avail. I will be returning this for something else. Very disappointed with ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin McComber

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk Should have bought The TP Link Router
customer_reviews.text: ****UPDATE 12-25-19 ***** ROUTER TOTALLY DIED ON CHRISTMAS NO LESS Interface is great Router so far is junk I have tried every consivible option to fix this router to No Avail. If you close to it WiFi flys. Go more then 20 feet and signal drops 50% Also Router gets slower and slower until it stops altogether if you don’t reboot it every other day Ran every patch for it only made it worse
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Good beginners Aimesh system. Buy the newer model if you can instead
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to use as an Aimesh system. The setup is straightforward and over stability has been very good. I have been using this router in a pair to take advantage of the Aimesh system. It has been good for about a year. Recently it has starting acting up and is dropping signal and I have to keep restarting or resetting. If These break I’ll probably get the newer Ax series instead. Still better than netgear which gives me stability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Glorious Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Always check warranty sticker on Asus routers.
customer_reviews.text: 5G stop working after firmware update Asus try to help but failed to get it to work. The tech support could not find the S/N number in there system sent a picture of the S,/N sticker then they told me my two year warranty was up and I only own it for six months. So old stock in warehouse always check the built date on the Asus routers and return them if it has less then a year warranty. Do not spend too much time with the poor tech support it's not worth the headache. Just return.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Avoid Asus Routers
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: Talked to product support and was infory router would be covered under warranty repair. Received an email from Warranty Services two weeks later that the unit I mailed in is no longer covered. After dealing with troubleshooting this unit for a year, I time it very unfair that they would try and charge me $120 for repairs to a faulty unit. Definitely will avoid all Asus products in the future. Many common experiences online where the 2.4ghz band doesn't allow connection. Have multiple laptops and smart thermostats that will not connect to the router due to the non-functional 2.4ghz band. A big headache that Asus seems to be ignoring.
customer_reviews.author: WolfpackFan

customer_reviews.title: no working 2.4ghz out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Wondered why I couldn't get my outside camera to work but I ignored that for 3 weeks while I used the router. I really wanted more than 4 ports which all worked fine. Then I found some of my other gear would not connect wirelessly. After much frustration I finally came to the conclusion it was the usual reported issues with the 2.4ghz network. I plugged my older asus router back in which I've never had issues with and everything worked again...sending this back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Lousy coverage...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router for it's 3 best features: speed, coverage and 8 Lan ports. This router is touted to be a top of the line gaming router with superior large home coverage. I have a small home and the square footage of my home doesn't even come close to the coverage stated by the manufacturer, needless to say, it didn't cover. The wifi signal was awful devices had trouble connecting to the internet (really slowwww) and the router doesn't work well with a vpn either. Unfortuneatly, I don't have anything good to say about the router. My old router (Linksys) not a mesh router provided way better coverage, better compatibility and superior connection and internet search speeds..
customer_reviews.author: doodlebug

customer_reviews.title: Running great, haven't had any issues so far
customer_reviews.text: Was a open-box/warehouse item. Have been using this for nearly two months now and so far have experienced no problems. The setup was easy since I have used Asus router for years. The new feature of Mesh network was also an easy setup without experiencing the issues some users have reported, and its been working great in extending signal coverage in my three-story house. The VPN feature is an improvement over older models with the addition of L2tp configuration. Overall an excellent upgrade for me
customer_reviews.author: Jidaa

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 Ghz dead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router as an upgrade from my previous Netgear router. It is great unless you want to use the 2.4 Ghz signal. I never realized it was missing until I wanted to connect my home smart devices (which typically can only use the 2.4 Ghz signal). I researched the issue and apparently this is very common and Asus refuses to do anything about it. I know it is a hardware failure because updating the firmware, using a third party firmware, and restoring to factory settings doesn't fix it; as well as the 2.4 Ghz MAC address is missing. It's a good router unless you are needing the 2.4 Ghz for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WHILE IT LASTED!!!
customer_reviews.text: When it works it’s great. I’ve had two. The first one was returned because the paint started flaking off. I had used this router for several months, it showed 2G and 5G. Then, I noticed sometimes it only showed 5G. Then I sent it back for a replacement for the flaking paint. I received my new router. It has worked fine for 8 months. Then I started noticing 2G was gone. Only 5G. A couple of months later, and now there is nothing. I would not buy this router again. I have others that have lasted years. I had two of these, and they both had this same issue.
customer_reviews.author: R. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last, disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This was a great router for just 2 years 8 months. Started having disconnect issues on 2.4ghz signal. Random dropping of devices, I would reconnect devices only to fail again. This happened starting monthly a while back, then weekly, then daily, then multie times per day. Resetting that often was a hassle. Updated firmware, 2.4 stopped broadcasting entirely. Did factory reset, updated firmware during that. It lasted less than a week. 5ghz has no problem, problem is 2.4 only. Unfortunately I need 2.4 for many devices. Very disappointed this expensive router didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced 300 dollars router that does regular 50-100 dollar router's job
customer_reviews.text: It is a very bad router for me. My old router is dead and I tried to spend big money as 300 bucks for a router that can do a better job as we now want better internet speed than ever. It turns out it is just little better than my 15 yrs old 70 dollar router. To me,it is not worth the 300 bucks as it doesn't give good signal and I already lost signals at first floor while the router is at second floor. People better spend 300 bucks at somewhere else instead this router. PS: It takes forever to get back online after you turned its power off. I should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Best Router ever
customer_reviews.text: Ok, had this router for a few weeks now and have tested everything it can do on my network. Security wize, Bandwidth torture testing, extensive load, gaming, speed test etc. Man this router has some really cool and exciting features. I have yet any issues with this router and by far one of the best routers I have ever purchases. Extreamly impressed and will definetly recommend this one to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M Perez

customer_reviews.title: Really hard to get working and stay working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product thinking I need a fast easy to use system. Well I was wrong ,what a piece of junk. I went on the web site and after 4 hours of tech support I finally got it working. Just last week we had a power outage and guess what it stopped working again. I tried for over 2 hours and gave up. The passwords were correct but none of my devices would work. All my devices were disconnected. I went to Best Buy and asked about something easier to use. I came home with LINKSYS AC2200 and in 30 minutes up and running. No more issues. Save your money and don't buy ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: DPT

customer_reviews.title: EXPENSIVE PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I owned this router for two months and it was very unstable and I could do nothing to fix it. It would drop out randomly many times each day. I finally had to use my old router and everything works. To Amazon's credit they gave me a partial credit for the return. It is an expensive piece of junk. STAY AWAY FAR AWAY! I should have sent it back sooner but I am a telecommunications engineer and thought I could make it work but no one can, not even Asus. I will never buy another Asus product again.
customer_reviews.author: Sandan

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: So after a year, we've not been able to get the full speed from out 1 gb/s speeds from Spectrum. If I plug directly into the modem provided by Spectrum I can get almost 1gb/s, however as soon as I directly plug into the Asus Router, it drops, substantially, and it's never consistent. I've contacted support and am always disappointed. The C/S is not the best in the world, unfortunately. Not typical of my other Asus experiences. Very frustrated, as I've cycled through hundreds of different settings, YouTube suggestions, etc, still horrible connection speeds. Wifi is even worse as I'm barely getting 355 mb/s
customer_reviews.author: wowgamer

customer_reviews.title: Router was fine for 6 months, now it just stops working randomly for DAYS
customer_reviews.text: After working fine for months our router started randomly dropping offline for days at a time, and no amount of troubleshooting seems to fix it. We are at a loss for what to do. We've tried support and resetting the router, one of the errors is that it cannot renew it's DHCP list. We are out of the return window for the router and couldn't be more frustrated, especially with how expensive this router is. Do not buy this product unless you want to get ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam M.

customer_reviews.title: Worse Router Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to take to my house in Costa Rica. I've had it 14 months. It was not until Feb of this year that I took it to install. The wifi never worked. No lights, nothing. Spend hours with tech support and after a long struggle, got the firmware updated. Still not working. I've now spent hours and hours working on a $250 piece of junk. At this point, I would never buy another product from ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and expensive piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS ROUTER IF YOU PLAN TO USE THE FIVE GHz BAND. So the way that they get "faster" speeds over WiFi is through the processors on board these wireless routers. The processor that handles 5GHz traffic very easily overheats, causing a complete loss of WiFi connection. This is a well documented problem with many of the newer generation of wireless routers. After three months of struggling with the router and ASUS customer support, I ended up going back a generation. I am now using a Linksys EA8300 and the WiFi bandwidth on the 5GHz channel is faster than most internet connections can take advantage of.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Masters

customer_reviews.title: Excellent range, throughput stability on 5 GHz. 2.4 GHz performance is also insane!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent range, throughput across two floors and multiple clients 70+ ft away. 5ghz. Getting 500 Mbps down and 500 Mbps up with a PCE-AC88 client 75 ft away on 5ghz. My phone gets 230 Mbps down and up in the same place also on 5ghz. Impressive! All the other routers I've had wouldn't be able to hold a 5ghz connection at that distance. This one not only has a signal but a very strong and stable one. It also has some insane 2.4 GHz throughput when paired with the PCE-AC88...easily getting 200 Mbps down and up, and that's in a crowded neighborhood. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ray W.

customer_reviews.title: do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on reviews. Supposed to have easy set up..Three of us could not set up so called tech support. Tech support worked on it for 4 hours finally got it to work sort of. Next day does't work, another 3 hours on the phone with tech taking over the computer again. Works for awhile until we log off than won't work. Third day with tech. Works half the time, crashes the other times. Its hooked up to our cox cable modem which is in a cabinet. The modem is three times faster than asus which is on top of the cabinet. Today you can slowly get texts but no any pictures. What a piece of!!! beware
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen T Gafarian

customer_reviews.title: Intermittantly fails
customer_reviews.text: This router intermittently fails with either no status lights or only one status light. Turning it off for a few minutes gets it back up and running. There are no error log indications of problem, it just locks up. Also, it is very warm when it quits. The router loses its Ai-Mesh setup when it fails. All other settings are retained. The second Ai-Mesh router is an AC-86. Both have current firmware. After multiple attempts, I have still been unable to reach ASUS product support.
customer_reviews.author: pr

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Fist router received was defective. Amazon quickly sent a new one. The second product was received and again defective! Spent days on technical support and they finally decided the unit was defective. Asus wanted me to send the product back to them for repair even though the unit is less than a week old and I've spent that entire week on the phone with them. Would definitely NOT recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: shoptilidrop

customer_reviews.title: Great product with faulty components
customer_reviews.text: I used ASUS routers all my life. This one is great since the main driver was to use built-in 8 ports and not needing an external switch. The product doesnt disappoint on performance or flexibility. There are 2 problems. There are too many open source components in this and thats why frequent update is needed. Second is the product is a bit bulky.. I was happy However - i found the 4 LAN ports (5-8). are not working. I read about it and its a common problem with this router. All solutions given on net failed and ASUS support was useless too.. Eventually have to return :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable wifi after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: After 5 months the wifi funcionality just stopped working. At first I thought it was because of interference I did a factory reset and it worked again for another week. Then both 2.4 and 5 ghz channels went dark again. Tried a simple reboot and it crashed or hung. I really have no time to troubleshoot it constantly. I need a reliable wifi router! Always been the biggest Asus fan, from their motherboards, powersupplies to their routers. Time to try other brands.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 GHz Failed AGAIN!?!?!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ASUS RT-AC88u router in early 2017. It worked good for the first few months and, after a period of time with a flaky 2.4 GHz WiFi signal, the 2,4 stopped working completely. I sent it back to ASUS and they sent me back a new one. Recently the new router started experiencing the same issues with the 2.4 GHz band and a few days ago it stopped working completely. I’m done with ASUS routers.
customer_reviews.author: Marc A.

customer_reviews.title: Not up to ASUS standards
customer_reviews.text: The first hint of trouble came during setup when devices would drop at random or be connected with no internet access. Then during a power drop, I noticed the router did not reset...I had to manually reset the device by cycling the power switch. A week later and the 2.4GHz connection is completely dead. This router is not up to the ASUS standards I have come to enjoy with their motherboards and monitors.
customer_reviews.author: John S Sadler

customer_reviews.title: RT-AC88U sucks for Mac users
customer_reviews.text: RT-AC88U has a horrible web-based UI, doesn't work properly on any Mac browsers so some features such as WiFi advanced config can't be accessed properly. As a result, can't get a legacy (802.1b) printer on my wifi network - unclear if it would work anyway but it sees every neighborhood network except mine. Also LG appliances keep dropping off, despite having worked fine with previous Apple WiFi device. After months of frustration, I'm going trash-can this thing and buy something better. Resell it? Nah, I wouldn't inflict this product on anyone.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Sorriest piece of engineering I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: First router I received was defective - couldn't connect to 5G wireless. Second router received is so buggy I can't believe how it ever got out of the gate. Slow link speed from a line-of-sight distance of <10 feet. WPS assigns an IP not even on the same network. Not all connected devices are listed in list of connected devices. Technical support hides behind a wall making it very inconvenient to initiate a contact. It's just a mess beyond all comparison. No more ASUS for me of any kind. Heed the reviews of others here...it's all true.
customer_reviews.author: Tp52

customer_reviews.title: 2.4GHZ went out after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: When the router worked, it worked really well. The setup was easy and the router has many features. But the problems started about 2 months in - started having random 2.4GHZ wifi drops (from multiple devices, tablets, laptops, sprinklers, cameras, etc). Then about 2.5-3 months in, nothing could connect to 2.4GHZ wifi (could connect to 5GHZ fine). I tried about a dozen factory resets, different version of firmware (including Merlin) to no avail. I had to walk through tech support calls, only to have them have me send it off to get 'repaired'. Will update this once I hear back from Asus repair.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It setup easily but dropped wireless
customer_reviews.text: This router became available at a reduced price so I purchased one. It was a replacement for a RT-AC68R that was the parent router for an AiMesh system. It setup easily and the mesh routers connected to it. The mesh started working well with the RT-AC88U as the parent router. After 36 hours of operation the wireless stopped working twice with a reset needed to connect again. I returned the RT-AC88U to Amazon and reconnected my original RT-AC68R. The mesh has worked fine ever since. One other thing, the RT-AC88U is large. It's 12 inches wide with 4 antenna and takes much more desk space than the 68.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Drops 5ghz band multiple times a day, as many others have pointed out.
customer_reviews.text: Could not recommend this router any less. As numerous other reviewers have pointed out, this router drops the 5ghz band multiple times a day, despite cool operating temperatures, latest firmware, multiple reboots and using Asus recommended settings. I've had not one faulty router, but two of these in a row. Same exact issue; 5ghz band simply stops working multiple times a day. My previous router was an Asus Dark Knight that performed flawlessly for years, so I'm both surprised and extremely disappointed by this router's performance. Sheer unreliability at this price point is, simply unacceptable. Returned both.
customer_reviews.author: Ace of Ben

customer_reviews.title: Expensive router that works well if you're willing to get inside and tweak some settings.
customer_reviews.text: -Smart connect doesn't work properly -with default settings you get a ton of 2.4ghz disconnects -The disconnects appear to be solved by choosing specific channel bands and expanding the bandwidth to 40 hz and 80 hz. Tech support was able to help me with that. -expensive router that doesn't work with default settings unfortunately. But seems to perform well when setting are customized.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan F Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Great Router/Easy Setup...
customer_reviews.text: The router is fantastic. Does everything I need and is a huge upgrade over the Lynksys router I had been using that was 8+ years old. Totally worth the extra money for the features on this router and rock solid reliability and speed. Dont expect the redemption code for Call of Duty Black Ops 4 PC to work though. I have tried in vain to get it to work or find support to find out why it wont, and its a complete run around. Just dont buy this expecting that code to work. I have no avenue to figure out why it wont work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gaines

customer_reviews.title: The best Router I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutey love this router. It provides two things other routers couldnt do for me: VPN Selective Routing which means I can have a VPN connection but limit it to certain devices. Kill Switch for VPN on Selective Routing whihc means I can kill my internet if my VPN goes down but only on select devices so I can still browse on other devices that don't need a VPN to protect privacy. I did have to install the Merlin firmware but it's practically the same software with improvements. Tomato Firmware couldnt do it. DDRWT couldnt do it. OpenWRT is clunky. Neatgear/Linksys couldnt do it.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with this AC3100 router for the two years and three months that it worked. Great coverage and killer speeds. Easy to navigate interface and until it quit, pretty much trouble free. Unfortunately three days ago it gave up the ghost: no wan, no lan, no anything but a browser interface after multiple resets. A bit of troubleshooting showed my modem is fine, so I'm currently using an eight-year-old Asus RT-N56U that thankfully I hadn't tossed or given away while I await a hopefully more robust replacement, a Netgear X4s. Wish me luck
customer_reviews.author: Larry Mowrey

customer_reviews.title: High Speed Router
customer_reviews.text: This router is super fast. However, I got tired of my wife complaining about her Apple devices not being to connect to the internet due their very poor design. This router supplies a very strong signal such that the Apple devices seem to work better. I like the fact there is less noise of complaining about the Apples stuff not connecting to the internet. THAT IS A GREAT CHANGE!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T

customer_reviews.title: Died in a year and half
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for about a year and a half before the 2.4 GHz stopped working. Contacted Asus it took several days just to respond. To tell me they would I have to ship it back and pay a bench fee to find out how the real fee was to fix it. I will not be buying Asus again. The 2.4 GHz issue seems to be all over the internet with this model. I would not buy.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Looks Like ZURG
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure I'm crazy but when I first booted up this thing it ran at the pace of a snail. It took 3 minutes to boot and every screen was a minute. I downloaded the latest firmware upgrade and all the features worked slightly better. The next day it was working faster but still annoyingly slow. Now after a couple of days it's lightningly fast. Weird. My only complaint is that you have to mount it on the wall with the LAN ports on top, (thus the picture) so all the cables drape down. It has the angular face that reminds me of ZURG.
customer_reviews.author: MHB

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I tested this router with the EX8000 extender against NETGEAR Nighthawk Pro Gaming XRM570 WiFi Router and Mesh WiFi System and VELOP. The ASUS router had major issues with 5GZ wifi channels and interference. I had to reboot the router and/or change the wifi channels almost daily. However the Netgear was much more flexible, but still had a similar issue but it was a weekly reboot of the netgear. All were better than the VELOP my final test was i purchased the Asus AX6100 and it has been fantastic so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Objective

customer_reviews.title: WOW.  Massive performance gain
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Asus router I loved. But the signal was not covering my new house and I was not getting the speed I expected from my new Gigabit network. Direct connect to the Xfinity hub and it was fast. But when I went through the old router it slowed considerably. So I decided to upgrade. WOW. Simply wow. The software is pretty much the same so that was nice. The performance is outstanding. It is just as fast as direct connecting to the XFinity router. But the 5g network is much better. It is full strength throughout the entire house. With TV's running and video conferencing it just keeps going. I highly recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: Pappas

customer_reviews.title: stopped working 8 months later, terrible support
customer_reviews.text: Avoid this router at all costs, completely stopped working 8 months later and because we bought it through amazon the return window is closed and so is the customer support. So now we are stuck with a 230$ paper weight. Worked great for about 6 months, but then started having connection issues, dropped signal, bad download speed. Then 8 months later i cannot even stream music from my alexa, can only have one device using wifi or all devices stop. So short story is there are better routers out there so avoid this .
customer_reviews.author: Phyllisha Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Big, but Good
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I am the farthest from an "I.T. Guy" that you can find, yet had our new ASUS Router networked within Minutes. Our (really) old Router still worked, but WiFi demands in our house over time simply overwhelmed it. My Hi-Res Audio streams sealed the deal. With this unit? We're living in 2019! Everything is working without fault. Note: This unit has a rather large footprint, so a Space-Limited Purchaser may want to investigate further. Without further condition, I am pleased! The ASUS Router suits our needs wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: NCguy

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 ghz band doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Router had an issue with the 2.4ghz band, the signal was terrible and speed was even worse. I couldn't even get 85 kbps on the 2.4 ghz band. The 5 ghz was great, no complaints there. If you limit to 1 band and have the automatic option then you get no signal at all. Only choice is the 5 ghz band. After some research online, this seems to be a known issue for this router.
customer_reviews.author: Fation Canameri

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the price point. It barely lasted 3 years compared to my old ASUS ASUS RT-AC66U... which I'm now using it to deal with tech support. Luckily I had this old RT-AC66U because due to Covid 19 Asus has closed call in tech support for wireless routers... so you can only deal with the issue in chat. Meaning you have to have internet. ..,. to deal with your broken wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: NomadTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does not support SMBv1 protocol meaning you ransom is inevitable.
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! Overall pretty good router. However if you want to connect USB drive for backup working with Windows 10 via samba, it does not work. ASUS don't support SMBv2 or 3 and Windows dropped its support to SMBv1 since this protocol has security vulnerabilities, See Microsoft bulletin MS17-010 Unfortunately I missed my return windows and I'm stuck with it for now. $260 down the drain. What a shame for ASUS. You better fix it ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Koby

customer_reviews.title: Loses connectivity
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this router about six weeks ago, to replace our old ASUS router that could no longer handle the strain of devices. We went with ASUS because our previous router was excellent. We work from home, so seamless connectivity is required. This router has to be restarted weekly, because if it is not, connectivity will simply fail for our laptops and we can't do our jobs. So every weekend, it must be restarted, and not only restarted once, but I typically have to restart at least 4 times to acquire full connectivity to all devices. This typically takes about an hour of restarting and troubleshooting. I will be returning this router and buying a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: azgirl65

customer_reviews.title: Great range!
customer_reviews.text: We have a decent sized yard with a pole building. With our old router we couldnt get a signal in our pole building at all. I had thought about getting a mesh router system to help. But the more reviews I read on mesh systems, I just wasn't sure if it would help without additional units. Instead I purchased the Asus router which you can hook another in a mesh network. But after buying, hooking up, just one unit I had coverage all throughout the pole building and decent coverage in our 3 acre yard. Other aspects improved as well. Happy I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Item stopped working and sent to ASUS for repair
customer_reviews.text: The product was received in a timely manner and is exactly as advertised. This item is amazing, easy to setup and configure. After using it for several months, the 5GHZ WiFi signal stopped working. I rebooted the system and the system would not boot up. I had to ship it to ASUS for repair in Newark, CA. The item was still under warranty but I had to pay for shipping. Still waiting to receive this router.
customer_reviews.author: James Haddad

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Tried to connect where existing router was installed. Worked with my Internet provider to get new MAC address loaded into their system. Worked with them and ASUS support for a total of 2.5 hours with no success getting it connected to the Internet. Finally, ASUS support recommended that I return it to the vendor I purchased it from. Unfortunate, because it looked good on paper. Amazon was great in issuing a call tag for UPS and a refund. Do Not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but failed before 2 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: Its worked pretty well for 1 and a quarter year in. Now WiFi shuts down when a wired connector is plugged in to its port. I like the phone app for monitoring my kids activities. The management console for the router is OK. The WiFi range is good but not as good as the Night Hawk i used to have. Since it has a two year warranty, I’ll see what they can do for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lancer Kind

customer_reviews.title: Product only worked 3 weeks.  Product tech support very lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Router work very well for 3 weeks. Then could not get any connections with laptops or phones. Modem and cable systems check out fine. Did all the recommended tests and resets. Nothing. Then spent 45 minutes with ASUS tech support. Nothing they/we tried worked. Then got disconnected.....did not get a call back and am trying to.....again...get to their tech support. It's not worth the money. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Brent J. Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Doa but they repaid my money right away
customer_reviews.text: The router was doa so I asked for a return and bought 2 smaller Asus routers lol I bet it would have been fine. I felt it would be unfair for me to give it a 1 star rating because I really think I just got a bad one. If you are in the market for a router I recommend the smaller Asus routers with the AI mesh I have 2 AC2900 RT-AC86Us and I can get 200mbs download over WiFi. I really don't think u need to spend the extra money for the larger ones like this model.
customer_reviews.author: scullydavidson

customer_reviews.title: My 2gHz band died within 12 months
customer_reviews.text: There is a known issue with the 2gHz wireless chip on these routers. The entire band stopped working rendering my webcams and other wireless household items that only use the 2gHz band completely useless. This is the second ASUS router to die an early death. Not what I expect when buying on of the most expensive devices on the market.
customer_reviews.author: NoGigs

customer_reviews.title: It is pure heaven...
customer_reviews.text: First I love the 8 ethernet ports. I have a TV, computer, phone, set top box from Taiwan, recast dvr all connected by ethernet, which keeps performance of these device at peak. Having said that, with the fast router, this may not be needed. I love how the 2.4 and 5 Ghz options share the same name. The router simply figures the best option for each device. Set up was very quick, although perhaps easier for me as I was replacing an old Asus router. The security features are also greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage, lasted about a year then just as other reviewers have reported the 2.4ghz craps out. Trying to fix the router is hopeless and there is no support or warranty so dont count on them holding up their end on that promise. Find a different router
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: AIMESH does not work
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this router as part of an AIMESH system with ASUS RT-AC86U and RT-AC68U routers. The first AC68U router would not work as a node right out of the box and could not be resolved after multiple calls with customer service. The AC86U worked as a node for about 2 weeks and stopped working. I bought a new AC86U and it would not work as a node right out of the box and could not be resolved after multiple calls with customer service. These products are HORRIBLE. They must have very poor quality control and/or the AIMESH feature just does not work. Do not waste your money, time, and aggravation on this system.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Wireless performance degradation after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I game on my PC which is connected to the router on lan cable, and I have ~20 wireless devices connected including 3 laptops and 4 iOS devices. Had no problems with lan performance, but tons of issues with wireless. I upgraded the device regularly and followed best security practices. Started seeing random network hangs on wireless where the wireless device was still connected but network speeds slowed to a crawl where even the router management console could not load. Setting the router to auto reboot once per week solved the problem, but I had to increase the frequency gradually until now I'm setting it to reboot once every day to experience smooth wireless experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as existing CR1900 modem/router
customer_reviews.text: If at first you don't succeed... retrn it and try a different one! With over 50 WiFi devices in a 2story 2000sf residence, I need better coverage and more power but the ASUS failed in 3 departments: 1. Coverage not as good as a lower powered AC1900. 2. WPS did not work properly. 3. No matter how I tried to tighten the antennas, they just fall/flop too easily. Next I will try 1 more ASUS. After that, might just make myself a tin foil hat and have a beer.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: For the coin I dropped on this router, it disappoints greatly. Even with Merlin WRT firmware, it has week signal strength 2 rooms away. I’ve tried all the tricks, changing channels, locations, powerline extenders, you name it. Maybe my 1969 raised ranch has lead walls- but this router was no match for them. Wish I’d purchased another TP-Link. Update 10/2018: I’ve tried it all and this experience keeps getting worse. I’ve added many smart devices (plugs, bulbs, dimmers, etc.) and they seem to be overwhelming the router. The speeds aren’t the issue- the dropped connectivity is. These devices are always going offline. It’s been a real headache. Again- I miss TP-Link reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Rufus

customer_reviews.title: Drops WIFI often: smart connect must be disabled
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but good range and speed but often drops wifi. After getting second same router to see if mesh helps still drops wifi. Called ASUS support they were very professional and only solution was to disable the hype smart connect feature which is supposed to switch between 2 & 5 ghz depending on strength but instead drops wifi for a few minutes. Very annoying. ASUS should stop advertising Smart Connect and partially refund people for this expensive router. Update: horrible still drops out often even with 5ghz is disables. DO NOT THIS CRAP!
customer_reviews.author: Nice

customer_reviews.title: Great control and load router
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Strong 5ghz band. Intefers with other 5ghz connections like headsets if your too close. The router is right below my desk so that's why I notice it. But this router definitely holds it own. Easily game with no lag with multiple people. My internet connection is 300mbps, at times I've had upto 7 people at once on PS4, Xbox, and pc, and the internet never lagged between us ever. On average I have around 5 devices at load, and about 16 others on idle/standby. You can prioritize certain packets which is very helpful for gaming, work, or streaming related.
customer_reviews.author: S. L.

customer_reviews.title: BAD to the BONE kick-a**
customer_reviews.text: i upgraded from a ac87u - and i no longer need the wifi extender in my 2000 sqft house.. this reaches, with little to no signal loss.. the interface is just as before, easy to navigate, easy to setup, easy to understand.. it has a few NEW features i had to read over, other than that - just awesome.. Its an Asus - what else is there.. wins every award, faster than you need, and with the extra lan ports, i can wire everything now.. even reaction times on my play station, are quicker.. movie streaming through my Plex is even smoother.. a nerds, dream router..!!
customer_reviews.author: roger wakefield

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 GHZ Band on wireless router failed after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: The 2.4 GHZ band on this wireless router failed after 18 months. Others have reported a similar issue with their RT-AC88U's as well (odd that it happens on the 2.4 GHZ band). Already tried the latest firmware, hard resets, soft reset and config resets to no avail. Symptom of the failure, 2.4 GHZ band SSID can be seen by clients are unable to connect (WPA2 password is correct).
customer_reviews.author: George Daswani

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: Had an Asus router for years which worked great until it fried when I think lightning came through the cable modem taking them both out. Replaced it with another brand which I eventually figured out was dropping wifi regularly for no apparent reason and the manufacture wouldn't assist. Went back to this Asus and have been very happy. Wifi is speedy, rock solid, and good range. Love having the extra ethernet ports, it let me stop using the extra hub I needed with my old router.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I really like the user interface for this router and I like the look of the router itself. It works pretty well except I do have to reboot the router every evening. It does have a feature to automatically reboot at a scheduled time which is nice. Also, the range on this router is greatly over exaggerated. I have a 2100 square foot house and I have a few dead spots. It's a good router for a small house.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Eveland

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly clumsy user interface, wasn't reliable, there are way better products available at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Was VERY disappointed by this thing. I've worked with numerous different routers and firewalls over the years (linksys, dlink, netgear, Cisco, Sonicwall, pfsense, etc) and found the usability of this device to be utterly awkward, OMG. The web interface is painfully poor, with reloads and delays all over the place. What was worse that after setting it up (eventually), wifi devices kept disconnecting from it. Discovered later that there was a new firmware update available specifically addressing this but come on, how can you put out a wifi router in the first place that doesn't at least do reliable well, wifi? The QA on this product must have been minimal.
customer_reviews.author: David Jameson

customer_reviews.title: Dont trust amazon refurbished products
customer_reviews.text: FYI. Amazon returns does not even plug in electronic returns to see if they work! Basically a recycling service. Mine was a brick with a broken antenna, likely a cracked board. Didn't even light up, a child could have troubleshot this. Disappointing to say the least. Certified used means it was used, that's all. Refurbished means they put it in a box.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Top notch
customer_reviews.text: This router is a dream to setup, performance is fantastic and the GUI interface is the best in the industry. Replaced a very expensive router of another very well known brand that had quit working after only 10 months of use. I should have bought this one in the first place. UPDATE: For those of you who want to mount this router on the wall, there is good news. The router AC88U does have wall mounting holes on the bottom, but they are covered. To expose them, remove the two rubber caps, on the bottom, towards the back side of the router. They look like 2-sided keyholes.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for AiMesh
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this for AiMesh! I bough 4 of these hoping to run AiMesh to cover my entire home. Nothing stays connected. WiFi comes in and out. It’s almost like all my devices keep hoping from router to router. Asked ASUS for help on the issue, they were unable to resolve it after 1-2months of troubleshooting with them! I have given up on these routers and plan to replace them for other brand soon.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Samba sharing does not work on this router.
customer_reviews.text: For an expensive router touting so many capabilities, it is lacking one very important feature I need and that is samba sharing so I can use it to backup my computers to an attached storage device. The feature appears in the configuration but does not work at all. Aside from this, the router is fast but that is all. Update: It seems the router uses samba version 1 which is outdated and Windows 10 will not allow connections to it. I downloaded their merlin firmware which updates to Samba vers 2 and this does work. So far I am a little surprised that such an expensive and highly appraised router is so flawed.
customer_reviews.author: JK Miller

customer_reviews.title: 2.4GHz failed after ~10 months
customer_reviews.text: Great app for managing the router. Initially had fantastic range for 2.4GHz, and what i expected for 5GHz, but after about 10-11 months it started hanging up. I traced it to the 2.4GHz frequency where bandwidth dropped to 1-3MB/s if I could get a connection at all. After updating software and replacing my laptop wifi, nothing changed. About a month later, it started running at 10-15Mbps again, but still much less than it should. At the same time, the 5GHz band consistently can get 175Mbps. Today, the bandwidth ranges from an occasionally 30Mbps but then it drops to 1-5Mbps.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: A big letdown
customer_reviews.text: This router had problems as soon as I took it out of the box. First I was unable to access the router setup admin and had to spend hours troubleshooting this with Asus. After that, I was finally up and running but then only the 5ghz radio worked but not the 2.4ghz radio. Ultimately I was asked to return this back to Amazon after again going through Asus support hell. It seems as if this was a known problem with this model after doing some internet research. Big bummer was that Amazon doesn't replace, only return, so the great Black Friday price I got for this was lost, but then again I probably shouldn't and won't be revisiting this router.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Hall

customer_reviews.title: From Loyal ASUS buyer ...DO NOT BUY !
customer_reviews.text: I have had ASUS Wireless router for ever (various models). This is one to avoid ! All my wireless devices drop several times a day ! I use wireless for working at home too. I hope to return the second one (already returned the first one) ...but I am past my return date ! Might be fixable but NOT out of the box ! Possibly to busy doing spyware stuff to keep my signal on line ! NOT HAPPY !
customer_reviews.author: Albert S.

customer_reviews.title: Try netgear if you need more than 1
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 of these guys, was going to set up the Aimesh. Just a bucket of garbage that is, my friends that are programmers and networkers cant get it to reliably work. Hell I ran 200 foot ethernet cords to connect em and they still cant manage to be reliable. Going to try Netgear next go around, sucks I blew so much money on them. I've bought about 9 asus routers in my life and dont think I'll ever my another one
customer_reviews.author: L. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not Good of You Have a Printer
customer_reviews.text: Stay far away from this router if you want this to work with a multi function printer. I am windows server certified and after 6 hours trying I finally gave up and will return it and try some other router. I got this because it has 8 ports, really sad to see Asus not try to resolve their print issue after people having this issue for years. Asus has a YouTube channel where they have a quick setup video for printers and everyone has been complaining for years and they don't even bother replying.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Stay away. 2.4ghz is skectchy at best.
customer_reviews.text: I like Asus routers, but this has to be the worst purchase I've made yet. I'm about to send mine back again because it fails. Asus supposedly sent me a new one and even the new one is trash. The router will lose the 2.4ghz band and stop connecting. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pooler

customer_reviews.title: great for the first 8 months...
customer_reviews.text: but in the last four months, the connectivity has become very inconsistent. I know 100% that its not my internet service because when I wire my work computer to the router with an ethernet cord, 0 issues! However, on wifi, sometimes its great, sometimes its bad. This happens with the XBOX, the macbook air, the Android phones, the iPhones, the amazon fire devices, etc. It doesn't matter if you use the 5ghz or the 2.4ghz. I realize now that I should have listened to all the reviews saying about how this thing loses effectiveness after time. Don't be fooled! It'll work great at first, and then start going weak...
customer_reviews.author: amy palefsky

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating experience
customer_reviews.text: Bought in Apr-2018 based on favorable reviews of higher-end routers in various trade publications. First 3-4 months router performed as advertised. After month 4, began experiencing dropped connections. Simply rebooting seemed to correct initially. After month 5, rebooting no longer helped. I upgraded firmware to latest available and eventually rebuilt from factory settings - nothing seems to help. In fact, I am writing this review hard-wired into the modem. After reading the reviews on poor ASUS service, I am not paying to send my router off to be 'checked-out'. Instead, I will be ordering a new router this afternoon, and will NOT be considering ASUS.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: It hooked up perfectly to my network and the directions are very easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how large this router is so make sure you have space for it. It hooked up perfectly to my network and the directions are very easy to follow. I have ATT Uverse 50 and connecting to this router I am getting a solid speed of 53 down and 11 up. That is with 3 TV's, 4 computers, 2 iphones and 2 ipads all connecting to it. If you follow the directions to the letter you shouldn't have any problems connecting this to your system. If you have problems you may be an idiot. I am very glad I decided to go with this router and the APP to control the usage is great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe R.

customer_reviews.title: Great speed however has issues with Chromecast you must enable ...
customer_reviews.text: Great speed however has issues with Chromecast you must enable ICMP but it still has some issues. Some times is hard to find Chromecast on your network. They have made firmware upgrades but still there are a few issues. My previous Netgear router did not have any issues with Chromecast. I wanted to more speed and decided to try something new. The speed and range are definitely there but don't understand why they don't fix the ICMP issues which Chromcast relies upon to work properly. This is shame given that Chromecast devices are so popular these days. If it wan't for the speed and range I could have given this router a 1 start.
customer_reviews.author: flaco

customer_reviews.title: Returned product. WiFi kept dropping and couldn't fix the issue
customer_reviews.text: I previously had an ASUS AC-1900 (T-mobile branded) router, which I had to give back to T-mobile. The AC-1900 was a solid router and had zero issues with it. I bought this router, ASUS RT-AC88U AC3100 router due to the good experience I had with the AC1900 and the AC3100 received good reviews from PCMag, cnet, and other online sources. Unfortunately, I cannot give this product a good review. WiFi was constantly disconnecting/dropping from my devices (phones, iPads, laptops, nest cam, etc). I tried resetting, re-installing the latest firmware, and tweaking the settings that I found on some networking forums. All of that did not help, which is a huge disappointment for a router this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: heq78

customer_reviews.title: drops
customer_reviews.text: Had this router over 3 years, drops increasingly and finally will not connect to the modem ethernet port (which is working fine). It starts up, internet light comes on then goes off leaving only the power light on then it shuts off within a minute, then repeat, repeat, repeat the same routine. I would avoid this brand. It is frustrating and unreliable. For its price point, quality in design and operation is seriously lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Ish

customer_reviews.title: If you are lucky it's the best
customer_reviews.text: Recived the asus on the 20th of feb and the first week of June the 2.0gz Chanel stopped working the 5gz still works but I have some items in my house that will only take the 2gz like my printer and outdoor hottub. After spending 2 hours on the phone with asus I have to send the unit back on my penny and they are very peticular on how you have to send it back will not take the original box, for the price I paid for this unit I should not have issues 3 months later. The unit is awesome super fast but customer service ver poor!
customer_reviews.author: Peterpr

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 GHz band radio is faulty
customer_reviews.text: After about 2 weeks the radio for 2.4 GHz stopped broadcasting. Now several important devices I have can't connect to the internet because they don't support 5 GHz. Firmware updates and hard factory reset did nothing. I can only assume it's a hardware problem.
customer_reviews.author: Corey B

customer_reviews.title: Works Well But Not For Long
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to an earlier review. This was my second Asus router in 3 1/2 years. When they work, the are great. Unfortunately, my first router died shortly after the warranty period. The second router was within the warranty period but it would take 7 to 10 business days, plus shipping time (both directions), making warranty service impractical. Wound up buying another brand - no more Asus for me. They don't last long.
customer_reviews.author: TLW

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed and Asus would not honor valid warentee. Very unhelpful
customer_reviews.text: It was a good product. When the first unit failed I purchased a second. When I tried to send in for repair somehow the registered name (they wouldn't reveal) was different from mine even though I purchased the unit, have all receipts and the the unit in hand. After many days and emails they said sorry. Absolutely no effort to help. I am 68 and cannot remember such poor customer service. Very sad. Steve
customer_reviews.author: Steve Goulet

customer_reviews.title: Big Two story house, big family, and lots of devices = a lot of users
customer_reviews.text: Best router I've owned to date! Super easy setup and UI is a breeze. So far very dependable connections. We have about 4,000 square feet of living space and a 800 square foot garage. The coverage is excellent and connected speeds are excellent on both floors and even in the garage. We have a lot of devices using the Internet from 4 computers (3 for gaming) two iPads, 5 iPhones, two smart tv's, 1 Xbox, 1 PlayStation, two Wii's, it seems everyone is online with something all the time. Two adults 4 teenagers, two younger kids. Some far no one has complained about their connection as they did before this one was installed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 13 month now drops WiFi multiple times a day
customer_reviews.text: This router was great while it worked I purchased it on May 31. 2019. Since a few weeks I have to unplug the router to force a reboot then it works for a few hours and I have to do it again and again. I have already replaced the COMCAST modem and the service guy mentioned its my ASUS AC33100 RT-AC88U which is malfunctioning. My previous router did last 10 years this one was a waste of my money. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: oro12

customer_reviews.title: I have loved it and it's features
customer_reviews.text: Second Asus router for me. I have loved it and it's features. But after having it for 2 months I am occasionally disconnecting for a few seconds at a time. Tonight it just stopped working no wifi lights on and no wired lights on. I rebooted with no difference in about 10 minutes it came back up. I will addend my review once I hear back from tech support via email. I sent them a system log so hopefully they can tell me the problem. I have use tech support before at Asus and it is first rate. I want to love this router but it has to work all the time.
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Still the best!
customer_reviews.text: So, this product had some SUPER mixed reviews to be sure, and I looked at probably 20 different brands too, but I came back to ASUS for the flexibility and features in their UI. I was not disappointed by the hardware either! I got the same speed test results on WiFi as I got wired into the fiber modem itself, and that’s a feat!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burnett

customer_reviews.title: 2.4 ghz died after 1 year and 11 Days
customer_reviews.text: A wireless router that costs $250 IS NOT SUPPOSED TO BE DISPOSABLE. The 2.4ghz radio in my router has died 11 days after the warranty is up and inside of a pandemic. Im beyond mad that I had spent extra$$$ for a nicer router to have to deal with this. I will not be Buying ASUS networking products again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Elllish

product_meta.title: ASUS Dual-Band Gigabit WiFi Gaming Router (AC3100) with MU-MIMO, supporting AiProtection network security by Trend Micro, AiMesh for Mesh WiFi system, and WTFast game Accelerator (RT-AC88U),Black
product_meta.description:
Style:Dual-Band AC3100| Pattern Name:Router

Wireless ac88u Dual Band Gigabit Router with 3100 Mbps throughput for smooth up to 4K/UHD video playback, support MU MIMO, AI protection, link aggregation with teaming ports and Smart Connect. The actual performance may vary as a result of network conditions and environmental factors.

Product Segment-AC3100 ultimate AC performance: 1000+2167 Mbps, Network Standard: IEEE 802.11a, IEEE 802.11b, IEEE 802.11g, IEEE 802.11n, IEEE 802.11ac, IPv4, IPv6, Wi-Fi Technology-Beamforming: standard-based and universal,1024-QAM high data rate,20/40/80 MHz bandwidth.
